I previously reviewed this game but I feel like it did the game no justice. So here is my second take. 

The most basic way for me to explain the game is as follows: A 5v5* first person shooter where you can either be a terrorist or a counter-terrorist, each role has a different scope and a slightly varied weapon set. 

*5v5 is one of the many game modes (Yes if battle royale is your thing there is also that).

The essence of the game is very simple but the gameplay itself is very deep.

I have around 280 hours as of the review and I am still in the lowest rank achievable, but is that a bad thing? No! In fact that is one of the best things about the game, the game does not reward you (gameplay wise)  for spending thousands of dollars but thousands of hours instead! So screw all that P2W crap and ride along the Waste-Your-Life-2-Win train!

In all seriousness, there will never be a reason for you to say "I dont know what to do now", because there always will be. Let it be aim training, map learning or in game economy management this game will keep your entertained for thousand's of hours.
